snippet.title: GrainCorp workers protest wages in Vic
snippet.content: Grain handlers in Victoria are threatening to strike after GrainCorp refused to increase its wage offer. Workers wanted a better offer from the company after agreeing to below-inflation wages to support the employer, Australian Workers Union Victorian secretary Liam O'Brien said on Wednesday. The staff voted to hold work stoppages, stagger lunch breaks and ban overtime unless GrainCorp changes its position. Originally published as
